key_points: Joe Biden arrived in Washington D.C. from Delaware on the eve of his inauguration as the 46th president.
Biden flew to Joint Base Andrews on a chartered plane, marking a contrast to President Donald Trump's arrival on a government plane in 2017.
Security concerns prompted Biden to fly instead of traveling by Amtrak as originally planned.
Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris are scheduled to attend a COVID-19 memorial and Biden will spend the night at Blair House.
Biden emphasized his connection to Delaware in a farewell address, saying he'll always be a proud son of the state.
12 Army National Guard members have been removed from securing the inauguration after vetting by the FBI found extremist views or ties to right-wing militias.
In his farewell address, President Donald Trump stated he prayed for the success of the next administration.
Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell accused President Trump of provoking the Capitol attack.
Three new Democratic senators are set to be sworn in, giving Democrats a majority in the Senate.
No specific plot against Biden was found as reasons for the removal of two National Guard members.
